perturbation.original_text:
ensure that in the event that it enters into an electronic commerce

     that all agreements with the third parties shall ensure that such third

perturbation.changed_text:
ensure that in the event that it enters into an electronic commerce
     agreement with a third party for the sale of goods on the Co-Branded Site
     that all agreements with the third parties shall ensure that such third
     party shall be wholly responsible for all products and transactions that
     may occur on the Co-Branded Site, that all such transactions shall comply
     with MediaLinx's standards and guidelines, and ensure that such third party
perturbation.explanation: By removing the requirement for third-party transactions to comply with all applicable Canadian and US laws and regulations, including privacy laws, the contract creates a legal contradiction. Specifically, it omits a legally mandated consumer protection concerning data privacy, potentially violating the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA) in Canada and various state laws (e.g., the California Consumer Privacy Act - CCPA) in the US that require specific data protection measures.

perturbation.original_text:
Any and all customer data that is collected from the Co-Branded Site shall be
collected and used in accordance with Canadian federal and provincial laws and
U.S. Federal and State laws and both MediaLinx and HCI privacy guidelines and
MediaLinx and HCI shall each own an undivided interest in such data. MediaLinx
will not have access to the HCI Personal Health Records (being the longitudinal
repository of personal health information about users of the Co-Branded Site)
during or after the Term of this Agreement. During the Term of this Agreement
and for a period of six (6) months thereafter, MediaLinx shall not use or
publicly disclose the data collected from users of the Co-Branded Site if such
use is for the purpose of providing health information, advertisements, or
products that compete with those that reside on the Co-Branded Site. In other
instances, MediaLinx shall be entitled to use or publicly disclose the data
collected subject to privacy guidelines noted above.
perturbation.changed_text:
Any and all customer data that is collected from the Co-Branded Site shall be
collected and used in accordance with both MediaLinx and HCI privacy guidelines and
MediaLinx and HCI shall each own an undivided interest in such data. MediaLinx
will not have access to the HCI Personal Health Records (being the longitudinal
repository of personal health information about users of the Co-Branded Site)
during or after the Term of this Agreement. During the Term of this Agreement
and for a period of six (6) months thereafter, MediaLinx shall not use or
publicly disclose the data collected from users of the Co-Branded Site if such
use is for the purpose of providing health information, advertisements, or
products that compete with those that reside on the Co-Branded Site. In other
instances, MediaLinx shall be entitled to use or publicly disclose the data
collected subject to privacy guidelines noted above.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the phrase "Canadian federal and provincial laws and U.S. Federal and State laws," the contract removes the explicit requirement to adhere to data privacy regulations in those jurisdictions. This creates a significant legal contradiction. For example, it weakens the protection afforded by PIPEDA in Canada and various state laws like the CCPA in the US, that mandate specific rules about consumer data collection, use, and disclosure. The reference to privacy guidelines is insufficient to replace the force of law.

perturbation.original_text:
In addition to the terms and conditions detailed in paragraphs 2(e) and 3(m), both parties
acknowledge and agree that any e-Commerce offering must be able to offer pricing
in Canadian dollars and provide shipping across Canada, unless otherwise
mutually agreed to in writing. In addition, all products offered through the Co-
Branded Site must abide by all Canadian laws and regulations.
perturbation.changed_text:
In addition to the terms and conditions detailed in paragraphs 2(e) and 3(m), both parties
acknowledge and agree that any e-Commerce offering must be able to offer pricing
in Canadian dollars and provide shipping across Canada, unless otherwise
mutually agreed to in writing.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause 'In addition, all products offered through the Co- Branded Site must abide by all Canadian laws and regulations,' the contract removes a legally required consumer protection. This creates a legal risk, because the goods may not be covered by the current regulations that require consumer protection laws, such as product safety, labeling, and warranty requirements. It could also lead to the distribution of products in violation of Health Canada regulations, for instance, if health products are not properly registered.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Canadian Consumer Protection Act, Food and Drugs Act (Canada)
